subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Monday, 16 April, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Man Utd must pip Chelsea - Waddle
Ex-England star Chris Waddle hopes Man Utd beat Chelsea to the silverware this season "for the good of football".



 
Ronaldo best in world, says Terry
Chelsea captain John Terry says Manchester United's Cristiano Ronaldo is the best player in the world.



 
Hibs players apologise to Collins
Hibernian's first-team squad say they regret last week's dressing-room revolt against manager John Collins.








GOLF




Weekley seizes Heritage victory
American Boo Weekley wins the weather-delayed Verizon Heritage by one shot from Ernie Els



 
Lincicome battles to Florida win
Brittany Lincicome wins the LPGA Ginn Open as Laura Davies and Lorena Ochoa struggle on the final day in Florida.



 
Heritage climax hit by high winds
The Verizon Heritage will go into a fifth day after strong winds prevent any player from completing Sunday's final round.








MOTORSPORT




Stewart tips Hamilton for title
Formula One legend Sir Jackie Stewart believes Lewis Hamilton can win the world title this season.



 
Coulthard upbeat despite failure
David Coulthard thinks the future is bright for Red Bull despite a third failure to finish in a row.



 
Hamilton sets sights on first win
Lewis Hamilton says he is not far from his first victory after becoming the first driver to finish on the podium in his first three races.








FORMULA ONE




Stewart tips Hamilton for title
Formula One legend Sir Jackie Stewart believes Lewis Hamilton can win the world title this season.



 
Coulthard upbeat despite failure
David Coulthard thinks the future is bright for Red Bull despite a third failure to finish in a row.



 
Hamilton sets sights on first win
Lewis Hamilton says he is not far from his first victory after becoming the first driver to finish on the podium in his first three races.








ATHLETICS




Holmes set to race in Manchester
Double Olympic gold medallist Dame Kelly Holmes will take part in the Great Manchester Run.



 
O'Sullivan 11th in Dublin event
Sonia O'Sullivan has to settle for 11th place in her final road race on Irish soil in Sunday's Great BUPA Ireland Run.



 
Liu signs up to run in British GP
China's Olympic 110m hurdles champion and world record holder Liu Xiang will compete in the British Grand Prix in Sheffield in July.








CYCLING




O'Grady takes Paris-Roubaix glory
Stuart O'Grady becomes the first-ever Australian winner of cycling's Paris-Roubaix classic.



 
Cooke's winning run finally ends
Dutch rider Adrie Visser wins the third round of the World Cup, Nicole Cooke edged out in the final sprint.



 
Hammond takes second in Belgium
Britain's Roger Hammond finished in second place in the Gent-Wevelgem one-day classic in Belgium.








FUN AND GAMES




Comment: Bored of the big two
Robbo dreading the prospect of a Man Utd-Chelsea trilogy



 
Mike Bushell's guide to swamp soccer
BBC Sport's Mike Bushell joins the Dunoon swamp soccer team for a training match ahead of the Swamp Soccer World Cup which will be held in the town in June.



 
Caption Competition 352
This week's cap comp features Andrew Flintoff
